item.title: Yoshi Eats Kamek in New Super Mario Galaxy Movie Trailer
item.content:encoded:
Another short trailer for the Super Mario Galaxy movie just dropped, and Yoshi again takes center stage, taking out one of Bowser‚Äôs most well-known minions in the most Yoshi way possible.

The new trailer, with the tagline ‚ÄúLevel Up,‚Äù features previously seen clips of Bowser Jr., Mario, and Luigi. However, there are also new images of Princess Peach with Toad in a cyberpunk-looking environment, and at one point, they seem to enter a bar, with several low-level enemies from Mario video games giving them a dirty look.

Yoshi is also shown riding a motorcycle, similar to what Mario and Luigi did in a previous trailer. He also confronts Kamek, swallowing him whole, lays an egg with Kamek‚Äôs glasses on it, and then pilots the vehicle Kamek was previously helming. Princess Rosalina is also seen in a brief action shot towards the end.

This Movie Takes Inspiration From Several Generations of Super Mario Video Games

This movie is named after the Super Mario Galaxy video game, which was released on the Nintendo Wii. but takes inspiration from many Mario games that came before and after the classic game from 2007.

A previous trailer showcased Birdo and Mouser from Super Mario Bros. 2. Baby Mario and Baby Luigi were also on display, being carried by Yoshi as they ran away from the realistic dinosaur featured in Super Mario Odyssey.

There has been no sign yet of Donkey Kong or any of the Kongs that were featured in the first Super Mario movie.

The movie is slated for release on April 1. It was previously noted that the movie was in post-production after animation was completed.

How did you like the latest trailer for the movie? What characters do you want to see in the movie that haven‚Äôt been revealed yet? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#972)‚ÄîAnswers for Saturday, February 7
item.content:encoded:
It‚Äôs time for the weekend to roll around, but before you can start relaxing or doing whatever you planned to do today, you need to complete today‚Äôs NYT Connections puzzle! That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm here, actually. I‚Äôve got the quickest and best NYT Connections hints and answers that you need to dominate today‚Äôs challenge.

Just read on to get the NYT Connections solutions you need for today, February 7!

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it‚Äôs easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It‚Äôs also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That‚Äôs in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What‚Äôs critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it‚Äôll be game over.

Today‚Äôs NYT Connections Hints (February 7)

Today‚Äôs NYT Connections is really weird. It‚Äôs not words, but symbols, which means it‚Äôs one of the toughest NYT Connections puzzles I‚Äôve ever seen. Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôre trying to solve today:

And here are the hints I can offer for today‚Äôs NYT Connections:

  • Yellow ‚Äì Roll the dice
  • Green ‚Äì It‚Äôs all just mathematics
  • Blue ‚Äì Used in grammatical fields
  • Purple ‚Äì Simple letters

Here‚Äôs the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 7:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 7 (#972)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today‚Äôs NYT Connections puzzle, I‚Äôve got you covered:

  • Yellow ‚Äì FIVE, FOUR, THREE, TWO
  • Green ‚Äì DIVIDED BY, EQUALS, MINUS, PLUS
  • Blue ‚Äì COLON, ELLIPSIS, PERIOD, QUOTATION MARK
  • Purple ‚Äì I, L, T, X

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That‚Äôs today‚Äôs puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that‚Äôs your local time). You‚Äôll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more‚Ä¶

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: When Is The REANIMAL Review Embargo Date? REANIMAL Review Countdown
item.content:encoded:
Prepare for some different nightmares in REANIMAL, with the review embargo set to lift in February. It‚Äôs a new stomping ground but familiar territory for Tarsier Studios, and fans of the studio will be hoping the developer can catch new lightning in a bottle.

When a new game arrives in all CAPS LOCKS, you know it‚Äôs game over. If you don‚Äôt know Tarsier Studios, it‚Äôs the genius company behind the sleep-interrupting Little Nightmares I & II. A subtle blend of horror, puzzles, and psychological warfare: So family-friendly, then.

If you want to know if REANIMAL is for you, then read on.

REANIMAL Review Embargo Date, Explained

Insider Gaming has been told that the review embargo for REANIMAL is February 11.

The good people at THQ Nordic have informed Insider Gaming that you can look forward to reviews dropping on the 11th‚Äîtwo days before launch day!

  • More Insider Gaming: Complete Reanimal Trophy List‚ÄîHow To Get All Achievements & Trophies

As usual, many reviews will be dropping, and you‚Äôll quickly be able to get a sense of what REANIMAL‚Äôs about, with Metacritic and OpenCritic rounding up reviews and giving you the critical perspective.

Everyone knows that critics don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre talking about, though! So, make sure to give REANIMAL a fair crack of the whip, whatever happens, and judge for yourself. If you don‚Äôt, it might come back to haunt your dreams.

REANIMAL Review Embargo Release Times

The review embargo for REANIMAL follows a similar release time pattern to most other big releases, dropping at 8 PM PT. If you‚Äôre based elsewhere, the time will differ slightly.

  • More Insider Gaming: Reanimal Release Date Countdown, Exact Start Times & All Platforms

Enough chit-chat, here‚Äôs a table showing you the review embargo release times for key regions.

To reiterate, there‚Äôs ample time until REANIMAL‚Äôs February 13 release date. If the company‚Äôs previous work on Little Nightmares is anything to go by, some pretty good scores are inevitable.

What review scores do you think REANIMAL will get? Will the developer unleash an even fiercer beast from within? Share your thoughts and discuss the game via the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Make sure you check out REANIMAL‚Äôs Xbox Game Pass status before launch.

item.title: First Look at Sophie Turner as Lara Croft in Prime Video‚Äôs Tomb Raider
item.content:encoded:
The Daily Mail has shared new looks at Sophie Turner in the role of Lara Croft in the upcoming Tomb Raider series for Prime Video.

On February 6, 2026, the Daily Mail shared photos of Lara Croft in action, showing Sophie Turner parachuting over a lake and running through the woods. Instead of Croft‚Äôs signature green top and shorts, she wore athletic wear and cargo pants for the scene, which was filmed in the rain in Surrey.

As of yet, there‚Äôs no release date for the upcoming series, which will also feature Sigourney Weaver and Jason Isaacs, and began filming in January. However, Sophie has already encountered some challenges while filming the role. She stated on the Julia Cunningham Show that she‚Äôd become aware of back issues during Tomb Raider training.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve learned I have a perpetual back problem, but I also realised that it‚Äôs much easier to kind of build muscle if you‚Äôve ever worked out before in your life, which I never had,‚Äù she said.

Prime Video Is Becoming a Home for Video Game-to-TV Adaptations

In addition to the forthcoming Tomb Raider series, Prime Video is also home to the popular Fallout adaptation, which just wrapped up its second season. They are also developing a God of War TV series in which Ryan Hurst will play Kratos.

Fans can learn more about that series here.

There is no release date yet for the upcoming Tomb Raider show. Insider Gaming will continue to monitor the story and report any updates.

Are you excited for the upcoming series? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
